intro: Phanera divergens, commonly known as the spreading phanera, is a flowering plant species native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its broad, palmate leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in swampy or wetland habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in some regions for its attractive foliage and blooms.
